column3: Washington is dominated by big money.
Making money is a happiness. And that's a great incentive. Making other people happy is a super-happiness.
America... just a nation of two hundred million used car salesmen with all the money we need to buy guns and no qualms about killing anybody else in the world who tries to make us uncomfortable.
It's a huge headache - the more money you have, the more hassles. I find money very uncomfortable.
Americans spend more money on Botox, face lifts and tummy tucks than on the age-old scourges of polio, small pox and malaria.
Waste your money and you're only out of money, but waste your time and you've lost a part of your life.
There are a handful of people whom money won't spoil, and we all count ourselves among them.
The only thing I like about rich people is their money.
I don't need the money, dear. I work for art.

One might think that the money value of an invention constitutes its reward to the man who loves his work. But... I continue to find my greatest pleasure, and so my reward, in the work that precedes what the world calls success.

Money without brains is always dangerous.

But I don't need to use politics as a way of making money.
